starfleet_message: While on a routine charting mission within the Briar Patch, the Enterprise-D detects a Federation distress signal emanating from deep inside a metreon-rich cloud. The signal is authentic in form and encryption, but unregistered to any known vessel. An investigation is ordered to determine the source.
mission_description: Investigate the unregistered Federation distress signal within the Briar Patch and determine its true origin.

dialogue_tree.line: Captain, the signal originates from a dense metreon field ahead. Sensor resolution is limited to thirty-five percent due to ionized interference.

options.label: Reduce speed to one-quarter impulse. Proceed with caution.
options.crew_reply: Helm: Aye, sir. Adjusting course through the outer edge of the metreon concentration.

options.label: Mr. La Forge, can we filter through the interference?
options.crew_reply: La Forge: I can shift the harmonic phase to cut through the noise, Captain, but it’ll push the sensors close to overload.

options.label: Mr. Worf, prepare a tactical scan and stand by shields.
options.crew_reply: Worf: Aye, Captain. Defensive systems on standby.

dialogue_tree.line: Captain, I’m reading a single vessel — freighter-class. The transponder keeps switching between Federation and civilian codes.

options.label: Could be a damaged ship. Maintain yellow alert.
Data, confirm the source of the distress signal.
options.crew_reply: Data: Confirmed, Captain. The signal originates from that vessel.

options.label: Worf, analyze their weapons systems.
options.crew_reply: Worf: Detecting multiple emitters. Configuration suggests modifications not consistent with Starfleet design.

dialogue_tree.line: I’ve refined the scan, Captain. That ship isn’t Starfleet. It’s a Nausicaan raider — the distress beacon’s been spoofed.

options.label: Hail them. Let’s end this before someone gets hurt.
options.crew_reply: Worf: No response, Captain. They’re powering weapons.

options.label: Raise shields. Prepare to maneuver.
options.crew_reply: Data: Shields up. Radiation eddies forming between us and the target.

options.label: Divert power to the deflector and open a secure channel.
options.crew_reply: La Forge: Channel open — but it’s unstable through this interference.

dialogue_tree.line: Incoming fire! Plasma bursts from the Nausicaan vessel!

options.label: Return fire — target their weapons only.
options.crew_reply: Worf: Firing phasers. Direct hit — their forward emitter array is disabled.

options.label: Fire phaser. Target their propulsion systems.
options.crew_reply: Lt. Worf: Firing phasers. Their propulsion systems are offline.

options.label: Evasive pattern delta. Fire phasers.
options.crew_reply: Worf: Firing phasers, Captain. Damage to their port nacelle.

dialogue_tree.line: The Nausicaan threat has been neutralized, Captain. They’ve suffered moderate damage and appear to be retreating.

options.label: This is Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the Enterprise. Do you require assistance?
options.crew_reply: Nausicaan Commander: We will drift on our own terms. Keep your distance, Federation.

options.label: Nausicaan vessel, you are damaged. We are prepared to assist.
options.crew_reply: Nausicaan Commander: Your offer is weakness. We need nothing from Starfleet.

options.label: We are initiating tractor beam to guide you out of the plasma field.
options.crew_reply: Nausicaan Commander: Disengage at once! We won’t be towed like cargo.

dialogue_tree.line: The Nausicaans are moving off, Captain. No further hostilities detected.

options.label: Stand down from red alert. Maintain position until they’ve cleared the area.
options.crew_reply: Worf: Aye, sir. Returning to yellow alert.

options.label: Resume our original course, Mr. Data.
options.crew_reply: Data: Course laid in, Captain. Engaging warp one.

reflection.line: It’s hard to imagine anyone choosing pride over survival.
For the Nausicaans, pride is survival, Number One. It’s how they measure strength — even in defeat.

debriefs.text: The Nausicaans disengaged after sustaining damage. The Enterprise maintained defensive posture without unnecessary escalation. Starfleet Command commends the restraint shown under provocation.
By offering aid despite their aggression, the crew demonstrated Federation principles of compassion and discipline. The Nausicaans declined, but the gesture was noted by Command as exemplary conduct.
The encounter resulted in no casualties and minimal structural damage. The Briar Patch remains hazardous but partially charted for future navigation.
Return fire proved excessive, destroying the Nausicaan vessel and destabilizing the surrounding metreon field. Starfleet Command opens a review of engagement protocol in volatile regions.
Delay in responding allowed the plasma fires to spread, forcing emergency warp egress. The mission to chart the Briar Patch is suspended indefinitely.
In attempting to assist the Nausicaans, tractor beam harmonics destabilized their reactor, resulting in loss of life and partial damage to the Enterprise’s deflector array.
